== Testing Aethercast ==
Aethercast is a way to transfer the image from the phone to a tv/monitor, currently it requires a microsoft dongle.
=== Basic Tests ===
# Connecting to a dongle
## Currently once the dongle is powered on or reboot you need to connect from an android device first, after doing so you can connect via the Ubuntu device.
## Connect by opening system settings and selecting displays and brightness
## Switch on External display
## Tap on Wireless display
## Select the dongle
## Screen say it is a track pad and the os is displayed on the tv/monitor
# Disconnect
## Open system settings move to displays and brightness
## Move to wireless displays
## Tap on the dongle name
## Os return to phone display
# Moving out of range of the dongle
## Move out of range
## Dongle connections is dropped and screen returns to phone

=== Advanced Tests ===
# Cursor movement
## Move the mouse pointer
## Ensure movement is smooth and acurate
# Clicking and scrolling
## Use the screen it click on web browser app
## In the url bar click on the clear button
## Long click on Shop link and open in a new tab
## On the opened tab scroll up and down with 2 fingers
# OSK
## In the browser click on the url bar clear it
## Click on the now blank url bar
## Use the OSK on the phone screen to type in ubuntu.com and hit return
# Reboot test
## Reboot device 5 times and check that each time you can discover nearby sinks from system-settings.

==== Known Issues ====
# Enable/disable flight mode does not cause WiFi Display enable switch to change . Caused by https://bugs.launchpad.net/aethercast/+bug/1574444
# wpa_supplicant claims P2P support is not available https://bugs.launchpad.net/aethercast/+bug/1574444
# Enable/disable hotspot mode causes aethercast to not find any displays https://bugs.launchpad.net/aethercast/+bug/1566674
# Needs indicator-network to respect Wireless Display Device name displayed on remote device not consistent https://bugs.launchpad.net/aethercast/+bug/1576613
